intro: Restio triticeus, commonly known as the tufted restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters near the base of the plant. Restio triticeus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
